subanswer.text: To find out Ravi's final expenditure using symbols, let S represent Amit's salary; then she spent '3S + (y/100)*Akshak,' where ‘Akshak’ represents Akshay's monthly income multiplied by M since they earned m times per year. Let U symbolize the value equivalent to 1 Rupee being converted to Euros or vice versa under parity conversion rates X. Hence Ravi's initial planned expenditure without any percentage increase due to amending financial decisions will equate to 'N = 3S + (y/100) * (M*Y)/X.' Consequently, incorporating Z percent saving against Annual Earnings yields Savings_Ratios=Z/(1+Z). Thus FinalExpenditure(NE)=N*(1-Savings_Ratios), yielding NE=(3S+(y/100)(MY))*((1-(z/100))) when all variables converge properly within consistent monetary standards.
